category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 18 (Restrictions on concurrent employment by executives and employees)
contents: Article 18 (Restrictions on Concurrent Positions by Executives and Employees) ① Executives (excluding non-executive directors; hereinafter the same shall apply in this Article) and employees shall not engage in business for profit other than their duties. However, executives may concurrently engage in work for non-profit purposes if they receive permission from the appointing authority or recommendation authority, and employees may concurrently engage in work for non-profit purposes if they receive permission from the chairman of the board. The provisions of Article 25 of the “Civil Service Regulations” apply mutatis mutandis. [This article was newly established on November 5, 2020]
